Windows NT: Yes (installable drivers for Windows XP, Windows XP. Included with Windows XP SP1 and newer.)
Linux: Yes (available as a kernel module or Filesystem in Userspace driver)
FreeBSD: Yes (available as a Filesystem in Userspace driver)
Solaris (operating system): Yes (available as a Filesystem in Userspace driver)

DOS: Yes (FAT16 from DOS 3.0, FAT16B from DOS 3.31, FAT16X from DOS 7.0)
Minix: Partial (via dosdir, dosread, doswrite, not FAT16X)

Windows NT: Partial (with Windows NT 3.1 to Windows NT 3.1 only)

Windows 9x: Yes (with 3rd-party drivers like Paragon NTFS for Win98 (page does not exist), Paragon NTFS for Win98 (page does not exist))
MacOS: Yes natively read only, write support with Paragon NTFS (page does not exist) or Paragon NTFS (page does not exist)
No write support since Mac OS X 10.6 and no support at all since macOS 10.15

Linux: Partial - writing support only to unjournalled FS

Windows NT: Partial (with Ufs2tools (page does not exist), read only)
Partial (with Ufs2tools (page does not exist), read only)

Linux: Yes - until 2.1.20  Experimental port available to 2.6.32 and later [80][81]

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [82] or partial with Ext2 IFS[83] or ext2fsd[84]
MacOS: Yes with Paragon ExtFS Ext2fsx (page does not exist) or Ext2fsx (page does not exist)

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [82] or partial with Ext2 IFS[83] or ext2fsd[84]
MacOS: Yes with Paragon ExtFS Ext2fsx (page does not exist) or partial with Ext2fsx (page does not exist) (journal not updated on writing)

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [82] or partial with Ext2 IFS[83] or ext2fsd[84]

Linux: Yes as an external kernel module

FreeBSD: Partial - Read Only from 6.0 to 10.x[88] and dropped in 11.0[89][90]

Linux: Yes with Filesystem in UserspaceFilesystem in Userspace or as an external kernel moduleFilesystem in Userspace

Windows NT: Yes (from Windows Server 2012 and from Windows Server 2012)
Linux: Partial - with Paragon ReFS for Linux

Windows NT: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs.)
MacOS: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs.)
FreeBSD: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs and fusefs-port.[97][98])
